title.rendered: Mohammedan defeated Chittagong Abahani by turning around

content.rendered:
Mohammedan turned around a little late after handling the shock of falling back in the beginning. The champions started their journey to the Federation Cup after defeating Chittagong Abahani.

Mohammedan won 2-1 at Sheikh Fazlul Haque Moni Stadium in Gopalganj. Mozaffar Mozaffarov made the fate of the match after Zafar Iqbal equalized the team behind Aziz Abolaji Abu.

On this day, the beginning of Mohammedan was simple. The team in the rhythm of the Premier League scored in the 13th minute from a set piece. Sujan Biswas beat Sujan Biswas with an unguarded Nigerian forward, Abu Ghraman, who received the ball from a free kick at the far post.

After falling behind, Mohammedans regained momentum in the game. In first-half stoppage time, Zafar raced over to find the back of the net after Mozaffarov’s curling free kick went over the wall and hit the post. The white and black jersey holders go to the break with the relief of equality.

In the second half, Mohammedan continued to increase the intensity of the attack. The 11-time champions, second highest in the competition, got the desired goal in the 55th minute.

A defender of Chittagong Abahani could not clear the corner head. The ball went to the far post, from where Emmanuel Sund’s head keeper Ashraful Islam Rana was blocked by Uzbekistan midfielder Mozaffarov on the return side volley.

After going forward, Mohammedan concentrated on the game keeping the defense frozen. In the 63rd minute, Shahriar Emon could not take a proper header. The gap did not increase as the ball that went up quite high easily deposited in Rana’s gloves.

At the end, Chittagong Abahani tried desperately to return to the match; But Mohammedan’s solid defense kept their efforts from outside the box.

In the 85th minute, Rayhan Hasan’s curling free kick attempted to find the net at the far post. Goalkeeper Sujan kept Mohammedan on the way to victory with a lot of jumps and fists.
